Gameplay is refined but since the game is a lot longer than its first outing those refinements don’t go far enough anyway. I found myself loving the exploration and actually getting annoyed when combat “got in the way”. I think the story is pretty interesting as a theme but the character kind of fail to grab my attention. I really like being conflicted and finding myself loathing the presumed protagonist but at the same time a lot of the choices that the protagonist does doesn’t really feel in character/plausible. When taking a step back and looking at this from a broader perspective\, comparing it to all games and not just it’s prequel\, it’s still a great game. Graphics\, audio\, animation and voice acting is god tier. The narrative and character development\, though weaker than the first game\, is also high class. As far as controversies regarding the game go I’d say: just play the game. The game does not do what it’s accused of. It does not push any agenda down your throat. It doesn’t fail in its story telling due to taking a political stance. Sure it’s not as good as the first game but it’s not due to anything related to the “controversy”. I think the game would have felt like a better experience if they skipped some acts/story beats and focused more on the driving factors of the main protagonist.
